  • plot_path (str): the path to save plot. Better same as the output directory of the experiment. E.g. './outputs/expr_name/1970-01-01_00-00-00/loss_cls.png'.
class STLAccuracy(clarena.metrics.MetricCallback): 
 23class STLAccuracy(MetricCallback):
 24    r"""Provides all actions that are related to STL accuracy metric, which include:
 25
 26    - Defining, initializing and recording accuracy metric.
 27    - Logging training and validation accuracy metric to Lightning loggers in real time.
 28
 29    Saving test accuracy metric to files.
 30
 31    - The callback is able to produce the following outputs:
 32    - CSV files for test accuracy.
 33    """
 34
 35    def __init__(
 36        self,
 37        save_dir: str,
 38        test_acc_csv_name: str = "acc.csv",
 39    ) -> None:
 40        r"""Initialize the `STLAccuracy`.
 41
 42        **Args:**
 43        - **save_dir** (`str`): The directory where data and figures of metrics will be saved. Better inside the output folder.
 44        - **test_acc_csv_name** (`str`): file name to save test accuracy of all tasks and average accuracy as CSV file.
 45        """
 46        super().__init__(save_dir=save_dir)
 47
 48        # paths
 49        self.test_acc_csv_path: str = os.path.join(save_dir, test_acc_csv_name)
 50        r"""The path to save test accuracy of all tasks and average accuracy CSV file."""
 51
 52        # training accumulated metrics
 53        self.acc_training_epoch: MeanMetricBatch
 54        r"""Classification accuracy of training epoch. Accumulated and calculated from the training batches. """
 55
 56        # validation accumulated metrics
 57        self.acc_val: MeanMetricBatch
 58        r"""Validation classification accuracy of the model after training epoch. Accumulated and calculated from the validation batches. """
 59
 60        # test accumulated metrics
 61        self.acc_test: MeanMetricBatch
 62        r"""Test classification accuracy. Accumulated and calculated from the test batches."""
 63
 64    def on_fit_start(self, trainer: Trainer, pl_module: STLAlgorithm) -> None:
 65        r"""Initialize training and validation metrics."""
 66
 67        # initialize training metrics
 68        self.acc_training_epoch = MeanMetricBatch()
 69
 70        # initialize validation metrics
 71        self.acc_val = MeanMetricBatch()
 72
 73    def on_train_batch_end(
 74        self,
 75        trainer: Trainer,
 76        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
 77        outputs: dict[str, Any],
 78        batch: Any,
 79        batch_idx: int,
 80    ) -> None:
 81        r"""Record training metrics from training batch, log metrics of training batch and accumulated metrics of the epoch to Lightning loggers.
 82
 83        **Args:**
 84        - **outputs** (`dict[str, Any]`): the outputs of the training step, the returns of the `training_step()` method in the `STLAlgorithm`.
 85        - **batch** (`Any`): the training data batch.
 86        """
 87        # get the batch size
 88        batch_size = len(batch)
 89
 90        # get training metrics values of current training batch from the outputs of the `training_step()`
 91        acc_batch = outputs["acc"]
 92
 93        # update accumulated training metrics to calculate training metrics of the epoch
 94        self.acc_training_epoch.update(acc_batch, batch_size)
 95
 96        # log training metrics of current training batch to Lightning loggers
 97        pl_module.log("train/acc_batch", acc_batch, prog_bar=True)
 98
 99        # log accumulated training metrics till this training batch to Lightning loggers
100        pl_module.log(
101            "task/train/acc",
102            self.acc_training_epoch.compute(),
103            prog_bar=True,
104        )
105
106    def on_train_epoch_end(
107        self,
108        trainer: Trainer,
109        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
110    ) -> None:
111        r"""Log metrics of training epoch to plot learning curves and reset the metrics accumulation at the end of training epoch."""
112
113        # log the accumulated and computed metrics of the epoch to Lightning loggers, specially for plotting learning curves
114        pl_module.log(
115            "learning_curve/train/acc",
116            self.acc_training_epoch.compute(),
117            on_epoch=True,
118            prog_bar=True,
119        )
120
121        # reset the metrics of training epoch as there are more epochs to go and not only one epoch like in the validation and test
122        self.acc_training_epoch.reset()
123
124    def on_validation_batch_end(
125        self,
126        trainer: Trainer,
127        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
128        outputs: dict[str, Any],
129        batch: Any,
130        batch_idx: int,
131    ) -> None:
132        r"""Accumulating metrics from validation batch. We don't need to log and monitor the metrics of validation batches.
133
134        **Args:**
135        - **outputs** (`dict[str, Any]`): the outputs of the validation step, which is the returns of the `validation_step()` method in the `STLAlgorithm`.
136        - **batch** (`Any`): the validation data batch.
137        """
138
139        # get the batch size
140        batch_size = len(batch)
141
142        # get the metrics values of the batch from the outputs
143        acc_batch = outputs["acc"]
144
145        # update the accumulated metrics in order to calculate the validation metrics
146        self.acc_val.update(acc_batch, batch_size)
147
148    def on_validation_epoch_end(
149        self,
150        trainer: Trainer,
151        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
152    ) -> None:
153        r"""Log validation metrics to plot learning curves."""
154
155        # log the accumulated and computed metrics of the epoch to Lightning loggers, specially for plotting learning curves
156        pl_module.log(
157            "learning_curve/val/acc",
158            self.acc_val.compute(),
159            on_epoch=True,
160            prog_bar=True,
161        )
162
163    def on_test_start(
164        self,
165        trainer: Trainer,
166        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
167    ) -> None:
168        r"""Initialize the testing metrics."""
169
170        # initialize test metrics for current and previous tasks
171        self.acc_test = MeanMetricBatch()
172
173    def on_test_batch_end(
174        self,
175        trainer: Trainer,
176        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
177        outputs: dict[str, Any],
178        batch: Any,
179        batch_idx: int,
180    ) -> None:
181        r"""Accumulating metrics from test batch. We don't need to log and monitor the metrics of test batches.
182
183        **Args:**
184        - **outputs** (`dict[str, Any]`): the outputs of the test step, which is the returns of the `test_step()` method in the `STLAlgorithm`.
185        - **batch** (`Any`): the test data batch.
186        """
187
188        # get the batch size
189        batch_size = len(batch)
190
191        # get the metrics values of the batch from the outputs
192        acc_batch = outputs["acc"]
193
194        # update the accumulated metrics in order to calculate the metrics of the epoch
195        self.acc_test.update(acc_batch, batch_size)
196
197    def on_test_epoch_end(
198        self,
199        trainer: Trainer,
200        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
201    ) -> None:
202        r"""Save and plot test metrics at the end of test."""
203
204        # save (update) the test metrics to CSV files
205        self.save_test_acc_to_csv(
206            csv_path=self.test_acc_csv_path,
207        )
208
209    def save_test_acc_to_csv(
210        self,
211        csv_path: str,
212    ) -> None:
213        r"""Save the test accuracy metrics of all tasks in single-task learning to an CSV file.
214
215        **Args:**
216        - **csv_path** (`str`): save the test metric to path. E.g. './outputs/expr_name/1970-01-01_00-00-00/results/acc.csv'.
217        """
218        fieldnames = ["accuracy"]
219        new_line = {}
220        new_line["accuracy"] = self.acc_test.compute().item()
221
222        # write
223        with open(csv_path, "w", encoding="utf-8") as file:
224            writer = csv.DictWriter(file, fieldnames=fieldnames)
225            writer.writeheader()
226            writer.writerow(new_line)

 73        self.loss_cls_val = MeanMetricBatch()
 74
 75    def on_train_batch_end(
 76        self,
 77        trainer: Trainer,
 78        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
 79        outputs: dict[str, Any],
 80        batch: Any,
 81        batch_idx: int,
 82    ) -> None:
 83        r"""Record training metrics from training batch, log metrics of training batch and accumulated metrics of the epoch to Lightning loggers.
 84
 85        **Args:**
 86        - **outputs** (`dict[str, Any]`): the outputs of the training step, the returns of the `training_step()` method in the `STLAlgorithm`.
 87        - **batch** (`Any`): the training data batch.
 88        """
 89        # get the batch size
 90        batch_size = len(batch)
 91
 92        # get training metrics values of current training batch from the outputs of the `training_step()`
 93        loss_cls_batch = outputs["loss_cls"]
 94
 95        # update accumulated training metrics to calculate training metrics of the epoch
 96        self.loss_cls_training_epoch.update(loss_cls_batch, batch_size)
 97
 98        # log training metrics of current training batch to Lightning loggers
 99        pl_module.log("train/loss_cls_batch", loss_cls_batch, prog_bar=True)
100
101        # log accumulated training metrics till this training batch to Lightning loggers
102        pl_module.log(
103            "task/train/loss_cls",
104            self.loss_cls_training_epoch.compute(),
105            prog_bar=True,
106        )
107
108    def on_train_epoch_end(
109        self,
110        trainer: Trainer,
111        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
112    ) -> None:
113        r"""Log metrics of training epoch to plot learning curves and reset the metrics accumulation at the end of training epoch."""
114
115        # log the accumulated and computed metrics of the epoch to Lightning loggers, specially for plotting learning curves
116        pl_module.log(
117            "learning_curve/train/loss_cls",
118            self.loss_cls_training_epoch.compute(),
119            on_epoch=True,
120            prog_bar=True,
121        )
122
123        # reset the metrics of training epoch as there are more epochs to go and not only one epoch like in the validation and test
124        self.loss_cls_training_epoch.reset()
125
126    def on_validation_batch_end(
127        self,
128        trainer: Trainer,
129        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
130        outputs: dict[str, Any],
131        batch: Any,
132        batch_idx: int,
133    ) -> None:
134        r"""Accumulating metrics from validation batch. We don't need to log and monitor the metrics of validation batches.
135
136        **Args:**
137        - **outputs** (`dict[str, Any]`): the outputs of the validation step, which is the returns of the `validation_step()` method in the `STLAlgorithm`.
138        - **batch** (`Any`): the validation data batch.
139        """
140
141        # get the batch size
142        batch_size = len(batch)
143
144        # get the metrics values of the batch from the outputs
145        loss_cls_batch = outputs["loss_cls"]
146
147        # update the accumulated metrics in order to calculate the validation metrics
148        self.loss_cls_val.update(loss_cls_batch, batch_size)
149
150    def on_validation_epoch_end(
151        self,
152        trainer: Trainer,
153        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
154    ) -> None:
155        r"""Log validation metrics to plot learning curves."""
156
157        # log the accumulated and computed metrics of the epoch to Lightning loggers, specially for plotting learning curves
158        pl_module.log(
159            "learning_curve/val/loss_cls",
160            self.loss_cls_val.compute(),
161            on_epoch=True,
162            prog_bar=True,
163        )
164
165    def on_test_start(
166        self,
167        trainer: Trainer,
168        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
169    ) -> None:
170        r"""Initialize the metrics for testing each seen task in the beginning of a task's testing."""
171
172        # initialize test metrics
173        self.loss_cls_test = MeanMetricBatch()
174
175    def on_test_batch_end(
176        self,
177        trainer: Trainer,
178        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
179        outputs: dict[str, Any],
180        batch: Any,
181        batch_idx: int,
182    ) -> None:
183        r"""Accumulating metrics from test batch. We don't need to log and monitor the metrics of test batches.
184
185        **Args:**
186        - **outputs** (`dict[str, Any]`): the outputs of the test step, which is the returns of the `test_step()` method in the `STLAlgorithm`.
187        - **batch** (`Any`): the test data batch.
188        """
189
190        # get the batch size
191        batch_size = len(batch)
192
193        # get the metrics values of the batch from the outputs
194        loss_cls_batch = outputs["loss_cls"]
195
196        # update the accumulated metrics in order to calculate the metrics of the epoch
197        self.loss_cls_test.update(loss_cls_batch, batch_size)
198
199    def on_test_epoch_end(
200        self,
201        trainer: Trainer,
202        pl_module: STLAlgorithm,
203    ) -> None:
204        r"""Save and plot test metrics at the end of test."""
205
206        # save (update) the test metrics to CSV files
207        self.save_test_loss_cls_to_csv(
208            csv_path=self.test_loss_cls_csv_path,
209        )
210
211    def save_test_loss_cls_to_csv(
212        self,
213        csv_path: str,
214    ) -> None:
215        r"""Save the test classification loss metrics in single-task learning to an CSV file.
216
217        **Args:**
218        - **csv_path** (`str`): save the test metric to path. E.g. './outputs/expr_name/1970-01-01_00-00-00/results/loss_cls.csv'.
219        """
220        fieldnames = ["loss_cls"]
221        new_line = {"loss_cls": self.loss_cls_test.compute().item()}
222
223        # write
224        with open(csv_path, "w", encoding="utf-8") as file:
225            writer = csv.DictWriter(file, fieldnames=fieldnames)
226            writer.writeheader()
227            writer.writerow(new_line)

Provides all actions that are related to STL loss metrics, which include:

  • Defining, initializing and recording loss metrics.
  • Logging training and validation loss metrics to Lightning loggers in real time.

Saving test loss metrics to files.

  • The callback is able to produce the following outputs:
  • CSV files for test classification loss.
STLLoss(save_dir: str, test_loss_cls_csv_name: str = 'loss_cls.csv') 
35    def __init__(
36        self,
37        save_dir: str,
38        test_loss_cls_csv_name: str = "loss_cls.csv",
39    ) -> None:
40        r"""Initialize the `STLLoss`.
41
42        **Args:**
43        - **save_dir** (`str`): The directory where data and figures of metrics will be saved. Better inside the output folder.
44        - **test_loss_cls_csv_name**(`str`): file name to save classification loss of all tasks and average classification loss as CSV file.
45        """
46        super().__init__(save_dir=save_dir)
47
48        # paths
49        self.test_loss_cls_csv_path: str = os.path.join(
50            save_dir, test_loss_cls_csv_name
51        )
52        r"""Store the path to save test classification loss of all tasks and average classification loss CSV file."""
53
54        # training accumulated metrics
55        self.loss_cls_training_epoch: MeanMetricBatch
56        r"""Classification loss of training epoch. Accumulated and calculated from the training batches. """
57
58        # validation accumulated metrics
59        self.loss_cls_val: MeanMetricBatch
60        r"""Validation classification of the model loss after training epoch. Accumulated and calculated from the validation batches. """
61
62        # test accumulated metrics
63        self.loss_cls_test: MeanMetricBatch
64        r"""Test classification loss. Accumulated and calculated from the test batches."""

  • test_loss_cls_csv_name(str): file name to save classification loss of all tasks and average classification loss as CSV file.
test_loss_cls_csv_path: str

Store the path to save test classification loss of all tasks and average classification loss CSV file.

loss_cls_val: clarena.utils.metrics.MeanMetricBatch

Validation classification of the model loss after training epoch. Accumulated and calculated from the validation batches.

loss_cls_test: clarena.utils.metrics.MeanMetricBatch

Test classification loss. Accumulated and calculated from the test batches.
